frame.name: Activity_start
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> initiates the beginning of an ongoing <fen>Activity</fen> in which he will be continuously involved.
</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Agent</fen> starts an <fen>Activity</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Purpose</fen> for which an <fen>Agent</fen> engages in a starting <fen>Activity</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen> starts an <fen>Activity</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Depictive</fen> phrase describing the actor or undergoer of an action. </def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Manner</fen> in which an <fen>Agent</fen> starts an <fen>Activity</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Means</fen> by which an <fen>Agent</fen> starts an <fen>Activity</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Activity
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Activity</fen> that an <fen>Agent</fen> starts.</def-root>

FE.name: Agent
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the being that starts the intentional <fen>Activity</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Subevent
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the first <fen>Subevent</fen> of the started <fen>Activity</fen>.<ex>The peace march <t>started</t> <fex name="Sub">with a prayer</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition: <def-root>Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants. </def-root>

FE.name: Containing_event
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE denotes an event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time during which the event or state of affairs reported by the target occurs and of which it is taken to be a part.</def-root>

FE.name: Event_description
FE.definition: <def-root>In general, this FE is used for phrases that describe the clause of the target as a whole. There are two somewhat distinct subgroups of sentence modifiers that cover this function.</def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. This often means that the Explanation causes the target's proposition, but not in all cases. I</def-root>

FE.name: Particular_iteration
FE.definition: <def-root>Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. In addition, most expressions of Particular_iteration indicate which instance of the series is being referred to.</def-root>

FE.name: Consecutive
FE.definition: <def-root>A consecutive event to the starting of the <fen>Activity</fen> of the <fen>Agent</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Epistemic_stance
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE modifies the target to indicate the legal- or other domain within which it is true or operational. </def-root>

FE.name: Concessive
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE signifies that the state of affairs expressed by the main clause (containing the target) occurs or holds, and something other than that state of affairs would be expected given the state of affairs in the concessive clause. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: begin.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: perform or undergo the first part of (an action or activity).

lexUnit.name: take_up.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: begin to hold or fulfil a position or post.

lexUnit.name: beginner.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: performer of the first part of an activity

lexUnit.name: neophyte.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person who is new to a subject, skill, or belief.

lexUnit.name: enter.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: begin to be involved in

lexUnit.name: swing_(into).v
lexUnit.definition: FN: start (a very active, vigorous activity) in response (to something).

lexUnit.name: initiate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cause (a process or action) to begin.

lexUnit.name: launch_(into).v
lexUnit.definition: COD: begin a speech or discussion energetically and enthusiastically
